capability_questions.question: Is the process primarily manual or automatic? use standards in the process? process?

levels.level_1: paper-based activity to accomplish tasks. SMA focuses on meeting compliance thresholds for state and federal regulations using state-specific standards. Very little collaboration occurs with other agencies to standardize information exchange or business tasks.
levels.level_2: automatic processes to accomplish tasks. SMA uses business intelligence tools to analyze data to support maintenance of the health plans. SMA applies a mix of nationally recognized and state-specific standards. SMA collaborates with other agencies and entities to adopt HIPAA standards and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) Manage Health Plan Information transactions.
levels.level_3: extent possible within the intrastate. Health Plan information is shared with Health Insurance Marketplace (HIX). SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for intrastate exchange of information. SMA utilizes a Unique Health Plan Identifier. SMA collaborates with other intrastate agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable business services.
levels.level_4: extent possible across the interstate. Health Plan information is shared with Health Insurance Marketplace (HIX). SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for clinical and interstate information exchange. SMA utilizes a Unique Health Plan Identifier. SMA collaborates with other interstate agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable processes including clinical information.
levels.level_5: extent possible across the nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for national exchange of information. SMA utilizes a Unique Health Plan Identifier. SMA collaborates with agencies and entities for national (and international) interoperability improvements that maximize automation of routine operations.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Timeliness of Process
capability_questions.question: How timely is the end-to-end process?

levels.level_1: mandated requirements for timeliness (i.e., the process achieves results within the time specified by law or regulation). The health plan changes take a significant amount of time to complete, depending on the complexity and cost of coverage affected.
levels.level_2: of automation. Timeliness exceeds legal requirements.
levels.level_3: collaboration, use of information sharing, standards, and regional Health Insurance Marketplace (HIX). Timeliness exceeds Level 2.
levels.level_4: time. SMA has interstate interoperability, which further improves timeliness over Level 3.
levels.level_5: Processes improve further through connectivity with other States and with federal agencies. Most processes execute at the point of service. Results are almost immediate.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Data Access and Accuracy
capability_questions.question: How accurate is the information in the process? the process?

levels.level_1: collection is manually intensive and susceptible to inconsistent or incorrect information. Stakeholders are unable to rely on information for decision-making. SMA stores information in disparate systems including paper storage and obtains information manually. SMA does not publish or widely distribute health plan details.
levels.level_2: accuracy of Manage Health Plan Information information but the decision-making process may be erroneous or misleading. Accuracy is higher than at Level 1. SMA stores information in disparate systems, but automation and nationally recognized standards increase accessibility over Level 1. SMA publishes health plans on state’s web Manage Health Plan Information site.
levels.level_3: increases the reliability of SMA’s internal information. External sources of information use MITA Framework and industry standards for information exchange. Decision- making is automatic using standardized business rules definitions. Accuracy rating is at 99% or higher. SMA obtains information easily and exchanges with intrastate agencies and entities based on MITA Framework and industry standards. Accessibility is greater than Level 2.
levels.level_4: increases the reliability of SMA’s internal and external sources of information. SMA adopts MITA Framework and industry standards for information exchange with interstate agencies. Decision- making is automatic using regional standardized business rules definitions. Accuracy rating is at 99% or higher. SMA obtains information easily and exchanges with interstate agencies and entities. Accessibility is greater than Level 3.
levels.level_5: industry standards for information exchange with national agencies. Decision- making is automatic using national standardized business rules definitions. Accuracy rating is at 99% or higher. SMA obtains information easily and exchanges with national agencies and entities. Accessibility is greater than Level 4.

capability_questions.question: What is the cost of the process compared to the benefits of its results?

levels.level_3: standards further improving cost effectiveness ratio over Level 2.
levels.level_4: standards for interstate information exchange. SMA increases cost effectiveness ratio over Level 3.
levels.level_5: standards for national (and international) information exchange. SMA increases cost effectiveness ratio over level 4.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Effort to Perform; Efficiency
capability_questions.question: How efficient is the process?

levels.level_1: Process is labor intensive. There is wasted effort or expense to accomplish tasks. Process meets minimum state process guidelines and SMA performance standards. Efficiency is low.
levels.level_2: Automation and state standards increase productivity. Efficiency is higher than Level 1. Manage Health Plan Information
levels.level_3: SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards and information exchange with intrastate agencies and entities improving efficiency to 95% or higher.
levels.level_4: SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards and information exchange with interstate agencies and entities improving efficiency to 98% or higher.
levels.level_5: SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards and information exchange with national agencies and entities improving efficiency to 98% or higher.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Data Access and Accuracy
capability_questions.question: How accurate are the results of the process?

levels.level_1: opportunity for human error. Health plans are inflexible and lock members into a single plan. Accuracy is low.
levels.level_2: business rules definitions reduce error and improve accuracy above Level 1.
levels.level_3: standards and information exchange with intrastate agencies and entities improving accuracy to 90% or higher.
levels.level_4: standards and information exchange with interstate agencies and entities improving accuracy to 98% or higher.
levels.level_5: standards and information exchange with national agencies and entities improving accuracy to 98% or higher.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Utility or Value to Stakeholders
capability_questions.question: Does the business process satisfy stakeholders?

levels.level_1: information negatively affecting stakeholder satisfaction with the process.
levels.level_2: provides clear and useful information. Stakeholder satisfaction is greater than Level 1. Manage Health Plan Information
levels.level_3: standards and information exchange with intrastate agencies and entities improving stakeholder satisfaction to 90% or higher. SMA uses survey or questionnaire for information collection.
levels.level_4: standards and information exchange with interstate agencies and entities improving stakeholder satisfaction to 95% or higher.
levels.level_5: standards and information exchange with national agencies and entities improving stakeholder satisfaction to 98% or higher.
